sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A letter sent from a private gentleman to a friend in London, in justification of his owne adhereing to His Majestie in these times of distraction: with arguments induceing him thereunto, both from the law of God and man. Private gentleman.
8 p.
Printed for V. N., [London] : Ann. Dom. 1642.
The first edition is signed "F", cf. Madan II 1285, Oxford books. Annotation on Thomason copy: "November 28th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A letter sent from a private gentleman to a friend in London, in justification of his owne adhereing to His Majestie in these times of distraction: with arguments induceing him thereunto, both from the law of God and man. Private gentleman.
8 p.
Printed for V. N., [London] : Ann. Dom. 1642.
The first edition is signed "F", cf. Madan II 1285, Oxford books. Annotation on Thomason copy: "November 28th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
V. N.
>>>>>>> imprintparse
